events.title: Universe Creation Date According to Johannes Kepler
events.description: The German astronomer Johannes Kepler calculated this day as the date of creation of the universe based on his interpretations of the Bible and astronomical data.
events.significance: This reflects early attempts to scientifically date the creation of the universe prior to modern cosmology.

events.title: Death of Explorer Ferdinand Magellan
events.description: Portuguese explorer Ferdinand Magellan was killed in the Battle of Mactan in the Philippines during his expedition to circumnavigate the globe.
events.significance: Magellan's expedition was the first to circumnavigate the Earth, demonstrating the globe's largeness and paving the way for global navigation.

events.title: Sultana Steamboat Disaster
events.description: The steamboat Sultana exploded on the Mississippi River near Memphis, Tennessee, killing an estimated 1,168 people, mostly Union soldiers recently released from Confederate prison camps.
events.significance: Considered the worst maritime disaster in U.S. history, it highlighted post-Civil War challenges and transportation safety issues.

events.title: Sierra Leone Gains Independence
events.description: Sierra Leone became an independent nation from British colonial rule, with Sir Milton Margai as its first Prime Minister.
events.significance: Marks the decolonization movement in Africa and the establishment of Sierra Leone as a sovereign state.

events.title: South Africa Holds First Democratic Elections
events.description: South Africa held its first post-apartheid general elections allowing citizens of all races to vote, leading to Nelson Mandela becoming President.
events.significance: Signaled the official end of apartheid and the establishment of a multiracial democracy in South Africa.
